[h1][b] Overwatch 1 > Overwatch 2 [/b][/h1]

Been playing this game since 2018, and these days were really fun. The state of [b]Overwatch 2[/b] now is truly disappointing. Current development team really sucks. Also, [b]Blizzard[/b] sucks too. Changing the game to f2p model is good and gain more players, but too many ğŸ‡²â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡®â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¨â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡·â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡´â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¹â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡·â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¦â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡³â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¸â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¦â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¨â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¹â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡®â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡´â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡³â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¸, making â€‹ğŸ‡«â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡·â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡ªâ€‹â€‹ğŸ‡ªâ€‹ â€‹ğŸ‡¸â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡°â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡®â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡³â€‹â€‹ğŸ‡¸ with real money, and selling the original free-to-play PvE mode in [b]Overwatch 2[/b] are really disappointing for old players and show how [b]Blizzard[/b] is greedy and doesn't care about their loyal fans. These led to the game's failure. Lack of communication with players, development team sucks, Blizzard sucks, finally [b]Overwatch 2[/b] becomes suck too. Hope this game still stands in a year.

Remember when "heroes never die" was such an iconic line in OW1? Well OW2 has no heroes alive with the direction it went: 

The downgrade from 6v6 made it less fun, sequel did not end up as PvE, new hero cinematics no longer have the same touch weaving together heroes as a story, battle pass just makes ppl have FOMO of cosmetics making the game centered on micro-transactions, and worst of all we no longer have our lord and savior, Jeff Kaplan.

I rather spend my time recommended by my friends playing FFXIV than this game using F2P business model to rack up moolah. While not a 1:1 comparison, at least FFXIV's free trial has more content/updates that values my time than this and doesn't have toxic teammates flexing their elo status. Spend ya money however you want, but spend it wisely. We deserved better, fellow gamers.
